definition: To decorate or add beauty to something.
mnemonic: Adorn sounds like 'add-on,' indicating adding something decorative to enhance beauty.
visual_representation: Picture a Christmas tree adorned with lights and ornaments, symbolizing decoration.
example_sentence: She adorned the room with flowers for the party.

definition: The act or offense of speaking sacrilegiously about God or sacred things; profane talk.
mnemonic: Blasphemy sounds like 'blast for me,' indicating something explosive or offensive against religion.
visual_representation: Imagine someone publicly making disrespectful remarks about a sacred figure, symbolizing blasphemy.
example_sentence: The speaker was accused of blasphemy for his controversial remarks about the church.

definition: The husks of corn or other seeds separated by winnowing or threshing; worthless things or trash; to tease or mock.
mnemonic: Chaff sounds like 'half,' indicating the part that is thrown away or not valuable.
visual_representation: Picture the husks of wheat being blown away by the wind during threshing, symbolizing chaff.
example_sentence: The farmer separated the wheat from the chaff.

definition: To use up the supply or resources of something.
mnemonic: Deplete sounds like 'delete,' indicating the reduction or use up of resources.
visual_representation: Picture a gas tank needle moving towards empty, symbolizing depletion.
example_sentence: The long journey depleted our supply of food and water.

definition: To involve something as a necessary or inevitable part or consequence.
mnemonic: Entail sounds like 'in tail,' as if something is following as a necessary part.
visual_representation: Imagine a contract with many terms and conditions that entail obligations, symbolizing involvement.
example_sentence: The project will entail a lot of research and hard work.

definition: To make someone agitated or confused; a state of agitation or confusion.
mnemonic: Fluster sounds like 'flutter,' as in being nervous or confused like a bird fluttering around.
visual_representation: Picture someone rushing around in a panic, not knowing what to do next, symbolizing fluster.
example_sentence: The unexpected question flustered the speaker, making him lose his train of thought.

definition: Causing horror or disgust.
mnemonic: Grisly sounds like 'grizzly,' as in a grizzly scene that is horrific and terrifying.
visual_representation: Imagine a horror movie scene filled with blood and gore, symbolizing something grisly.
example_sentence: The police arrived at the scene of the grisly crime.

definition: A person who receives or entertains guests; an animal or plant on or in which a parasite or commensal organism lives; to act as host at (an event).
mnemonic: Host sounds like 'toast,' as in toasting to welcome guests.
visual_representation: Picture a warm, welcoming host greeting guests at a dinner party.
example_sentence: The host made sure all the guests were comfortable.

definition: Designed to cause fires; tending to stir up conflict; a person who starts fires, especially in a military context.
mnemonic: Incendiary sounds like 'incense diary,' as if something is set to ignite or provoke.
visual_representation: Picture a firebomb exploding and causing chaos, symbolizing something incendiary.
example_sentence: The incendiary speech incited the crowd to riot.

definition: Very vivid in color, especially so as to create an unpleasantly harsh or unnatural effect; presented in vividly shocking or sensational terms.
mnemonic: Lurid sounds like 'lure it,' as in something that is shockingly attractive or repulsive.
visual_representation: Picture a tabloid newspaper with a lurid, sensational headline.
example_sentence: The lurid details of the crime were splashed across the front pages of the newspapers.

definition: Denoting an animal that migrates; moving from one place to another at different times of the year.
mnemonic: Migratory sounds like 'migrate story,' indicating animals or people who move from place to place.
visual_representation: Picture a flock of birds flying south for the winter, symbolizing migratory behavior.
example_sentence: The migratory patterns of birds change with the seasons.

definition: A person who is new to a subject, skill, or belief.
mnemonic: Neophyte sounds like 'new-fight,' as if someone is new to a field and just beginning to fight or struggle.
visual_representation: Imagine a beginner struggling to learn a new skill, symbolizing a neophyte.
example_sentence: As a neophyte to the sport, she needed a lot of practice.

definition: Required by a legal, moral, or other rule; compulsory.
mnemonic: Obligatory sounds like 'obliged,' indicating something that one is required or bound to do.
visual_representation: Picture a sign that says 'Mandatory,' symbolizing something obligatory.
example_sentence: Attending the meeting was obligatory for all staff members.

definition: (Of an action or gesture) carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection.
mnemonic: Perfunctory sounds like 'perform factory,' indicating a mechanical or routine action done without much thought.
visual_representation: Picture someone shaking hands without looking, in a mechanical, uninterested way, symbolizing a perfunctory gesture.
example_sentence: His perfunctory response indicated that he wasn’t really listening.

definition: A story told about a past event remembered by the narrator; the enjoyable recollection of past events.
mnemonic: Reminiscence sounds like 're-mini-scene,' as in replaying a small scene from the past in your mind.
visual_representation: Picture someone smiling while looking at an old photo, lost in fond memories, symbolizing reminiscence.
example_sentence: The elderly man’s reminiscence of his childhood brought a smile to his face.

definition: A state of total disorder.
mnemonic: Shambles sounds like 'sham-balls,' as if a situation is a total mess or chaos.
visual_representation: Imagine a room with papers and objects scattered everywhere, symbolizing a shambles.
example_sentence: After the party, the house was left in a complete shambles.

definition: To put (thoughts, speech, or data) into written or printed form.
mnemonic: Transcribe sounds like 'transfer scribble,' indicating transferring spoken or thought words into writing.
visual_representation: Picture someone typing out a recorded conversation, symbolizing transcription.
example_sentence: The secretary transcribed the minutes of the meeting for the official record.

definition: Without making any mistakes; perfectly accurate.
mnemonic: Unerringly sounds like 'un-error-ring,' indicating something done without errors or mistakes.
visual_representation: Picture an archer hitting the bullseye every time, symbolizing unerring accuracy.
example_sentence: She unerringly predicted the outcome of the election.

definition: A mythical being who subsists by feeding on the vital essence (usually blood) of the living.
mnemonic: Vampire sounds like 'vamp-pyre,' indicating a dark, blood-sucking creature of the night.
visual_representation: Picture a vampire with sharp fangs and a cape, symbolizing the mythical creature.
example_sentence: The legend of the vampire has been popularized by countless books and movies.

definition: To pass or cause to pass gently through the air; a gentle movement of air.
hindi_meaning: हवा में बहना, सुगंध का झोंका
mnemonic: Waft sounds like 'raft,' gently floating through the air or water.
visual_representation: Imagine the smell of fresh flowers gently wafting through an open window.
example_sentence: The scent of freshly baked bread wafted through the kitchen.
